title: Artist Profile: Raquel Yago Boj
content:
Beautiful photographs of the Fuerteventura landscape with the small but impacting interjection of matt coloured squares.

Playing with what we understand now a days as post production in photography, the manipulation of what is real or what’s been created in the facility of Photoshop etc. But these photographs subtly show that these alien objects were physically there, some shadow, a scratch, an imperfection, they are as three dimensional and real as their surroundings.

The interaction between dirt, rocks, heather and rubble and the pops of colour from these ‘other’ type objects creates beautiful and dynamic images. The colours in the squares enhancing the colour pallet of the whole piece.

See more of her work here.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d43
